intro: Eumachia obovoidea subsp. longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-pedunculate eumachia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its elliptical, obovate leaves that are often pubescent on the underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with white to pale pink petals, typically arranged in elongated peduncles. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its genus.
